Message.Msg: I love how you Tea Brains think. Everything is some attempt to extort money from American taxpayers, as if the world is made up of jealous old misers counting pennies. North Korea's entire system is based on a delusion--that totalitarian Communism and the rule of Dear leader are the only things that protect them from the American Imperialists. If (or I should say when) that delusion collapses, the leaders of North Korea are in for a very harsh reckoning. To maintain that delusion, there must be a certain level of confrontation with the US. It is a dangerous game for N. Korea but without it the regime would collapse. What happens in N. Korea has alot more to do with internal politics than with the US. Message.Msg: "The only individual right Tea Brains care about is the right to buy an assault rifle." In one message string you contradict yourself several times. You have listed several complaints about what the Tea Party wants, then say they only have one individual right they care about. You don't know what the Tea Party stands for you just know you're against anything they stand for and support anything the liberal's want to inflict on this country. And before you go on some ballistic rant about my being a Tea Party member, understand that I don't agree with their approach to many things, I don't believe they are a legitimate political Party in this country. I think the Lame Stream Media came up with that name because they couldn't think of anything else to call people that don't happen to subscribe to their version of a world order, any world other than the one right in front of them that they can follow without much thought. “Obama administration decided not to defend the law the Tea Brains were all up in arms about his "Constitutional duty" to defend the law.” You don’t think that it is important that when a seated Congress writes a law that the President and the Department of Justice follow the law of the land and enforce ALL those laws? Do you feel it is an option for those two entities to arbitrarily decide which laws they like and don’t like and which they will enforce? That is not the actions of a democratic or representative government; that is an autocracy pushing toward dictatorship. If you feel that a law is unacceptable, there are processes in this country to change those laws. Ignorance of the law is no excuse to not adhere to a law and ignoring laws because they don’t please you, personally or politically should not be allowed either.

Message.Title: Could Gap Up and Explode Big Time Tomorrow
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) low float mobile play - amazing fundamentals and technicals, could gap up big and explode tomorrow! CCUR currently $7.91 with 9.2mm o/s cash of $24.6mm no debt an enterprise value (EV) of $48.17 million or just 0.77x revenue. CCUR together with Seachange (SEAC) control the majority of the global video on demand (VOD) market. SEAC just hit a new 52-week high last week and is now trading with an EV/revenue ratio of 1.89, which would value CCUR over $15.50. While SEAC has gross margins of 50.18% and is losing money, CCUR has gross margins of 58.81% and was profitable the past four consecutive quarters. CCUR's EPS has been ramping up big - last quarter it was up 100% from the previous quarter and 300% from two quarters ago. CCUR's clients include 6 of the 8 largest cable TV companies in the U.S. CCUR just announced last month that a new undisclosed Top 5 North American pay-TV service provider has signed on as a new client. CCUR and SEAC are about to capitalize on the new biggest cable TV spending boom, as cable TV subscribers demand access to live TV and on demand content on their tablets/smartphones. CCUR's MediaHawk unified multi-screen video solution is already powering a new multi-screen service called Xvie that was just launched by Jupiter (JUPIY) the largest cable TV company in Japan. Just the other day, CCUR announced a brand new huge multi-screen client Virgin Media (VMED) the largest cable TV company in the UK with 3.8 million subscribers. VMED could add greatly to CCUR's revenues and profits in the upcoming quarters as they deploy CCUR's MediaHawk to power their new multi-screen service - Virgin TV Anywhere. Both CCUR and SEAC have been rumored takeover targets (Google it) and major consolidation is already taking place in the industry this year.

Message.Msg: I won't mind living among my fellow Americans and my kids will be more than capable of competing in the labor market. I do not grant anyone anything. God has granted us all with certain unalienable rights. On the contrary, as a white male in America I have been granted a certain amount of privilege. I am neither jealous of this privilege nor do I eschew its value. I do have quite a bit of contempt for people like you who have had similar access to privilege but still think they need government enforced racial supremacy to compete in this world. THAT is why real white men have nothing but contempt for racist cowards like you. I can compete or collaborate with anyone, man-to-man, and I welcome the competition. I do not hide behind race. I do not live in fear. You are a contemptible little coward. I have and do work with and compete with many people who are not white on a daily basis. This is not abstract or from a distance. This is on the streets where I grew up and in the marketplace where I work now. I KNOW you are the lesser man. And don't you forget it.
